Key Match Events: Matt Olson drove in the go-ahead run on a fielder's choice
Travis d'Arnaud added an RBI single
Ram√≥n Laureano put the game away with a two-run double as the Atlanta Braves scored four times in the 10th inning
Trevor Larnach's game-tying RBI double to score an inherited runner with two outs in the eighth
Pierce Johnson allowed two runs in the 10th but struck out Matt Wallner with the tying run at first to end it
Miscellaneous Highlights: Michael Harris hit his eighth homer of the year in the second
Marcell Ozuna added two hits, including a two-run double in the fifth
Larnach and Julien had RBI doubles and Wallner added an RBI single in Minnesota's three-run seventh
Rookie Spencer Schwellenbach started against Minnesota rookie Simeon Woods Richardson, which marked the most combined letters in the last names of a starting pitching matchup in major league history
The game was just the fourth time in 23 starts that Woods Richardson allowed four runs or more
Others: Minnesota made Schwellenbach work with 106 pitches in 4 2/3 innings
Woods Richardson (5-4) was also out after 4 2/3 innings with four runs allowed on three hits and three walks
The Twins' Joe Ryan was transferred to the 60-day injured list due to a right shoulder strain
Chris Sale will start Wednesday evening's series finale for Atlanta, while Minnesota counters with rookie RHP David Festa
